definition[0]: used to suggest or offer something to someone
example[0]: I can give you her phone number, if you like.
example[1]: If you like, I could go with you.
definition[1]: used to agree to something, even if it is not really what you want yourself
example[2]: ‘Shall we get a takeaway on the way home?’ ‘If you like.’
definition[2]: used to suggest one possible way of describing something or someone
example[3]: We don’t have a proper agreement, but we have an informal understanding, if you like.
